DataElement.preferredName: Colorectal Neoplasm Item Collection Specimen Characteristic Other Surgical Procedure java.lang.String
DataElement.preferredDefinition: User-entered text specifying a surgical procedure that is not in the list of values provided

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Colorectal Neoplasm Item Collection Specimen Characteristic Other Surgical Procedure
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Benign or malignant abnormal growth in the colon or rectum.:A group of items of the same type, gathered for display or study.:A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid ta:The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:Surgical Procedure is a diagnostic or treatment medical procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Colorectal Neoplasm Item Collection Specimen Characteristic
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Benign or malignant abnormal growth in the colon or rectum.:A group of items of the same type, gathered for display or study.:A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid ta:The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the colon or rectum.  Representative examples of benign neoplasms include lipoma and leiomyoma.  Representative examples of malignant neoplasms include carcinoma, lymphoma, and sarcoma.  Colorectal adenomas always exhibit epithelial dysplasia and are considered premalignant neoplasms.
A group of items of the same type, gathered for display or study.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.
The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

Property.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.:Surgical Procedure is a diagnostic or treatment medical procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
